text: The National Museum of Roman Art () in Mérida (Badajoz), Spain is an archaeology museum located in the Archaeological Ensemble of Mérida, the archaeological site of the Roman colony of Augusta Emerita, one of the largest and most extensive archaeological sites in Spain. Established on March 26, 1838 as Museo Arqueológico de Mérida, the current building, opened on September 19, 1986 is a work by Spanish architect Rafael Moneo. The museum is a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1993, as a part of the Archaeological Ensemble of Mérida. == Gallery == File:Museo Nacional de Arte Romano 2019An004.jpg|Main Hall File:Diosa_Ceres_siglo_I_d.C.jpg|Seated Ceres (1st century AD) File:LutaciaLupata.JPG|Lutatia Lupata Stele File:Calzada Emerita Augusta Caesar augusta.JPG|Roman road File:Mercurio (17764571442).jpg|Mercury File:Augusto, emperador (11649357954).jpg|Augustus as Pontifex maximus File:EmeritaAugusta.JPG|Augusta Emerita scale model File:Museo de Arte Romano (1986) Mérida.jpg|Upper level corridor File:Museo Romano Merida.JPG|Roman statues and reliefs File:Tres ánforas (MNAR Mérida) 01.jpg|Roman Amphoras File:Mosaico de Las Tiendas (MNAR Mérida) 01.jpg|Las Tiendas mosaic File:Cabeza masculina (3913044525).jpg|Man ==References== Category:Cultural tourism in Spain Category:National museums of Spain Category:Museums of ancient Rome in Spain Category:Museums in Extremadura Category:Museums established in 1838 Category:1838 establishments in Spain
